### Steps to reproduce

Hello

I installed powershell v7.1 for mac.
I am facing the following issue when executing Get-NetIPAddress: 
![pbPS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8555147/123838898-c7366d80-d90c-11eb-835d-17f9e2951c37.jpg)

Is this cmdlet supposed to be supported in such env ?

Regards.

nikk0 

### Expected behavior

```console
I expect Get-NetIPAddress working.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Get-NetIPAddress: The term 'Get-NetIPAddress' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
To my knowledge, that cmdlet is only available on Windows. It uses some Windows OS APIs that aren't available on other platforms.

A quick search seems to indicate that probably the nearest approximation currently available on Unix systems is:

```powershell
[System.Net.Dns]::GetHostAddresses($(hostname))
```

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body:
> It uses some Windows OS APIs that aren't available on other platforms.

More specifically it's a CDXML cmdlet that relies on CIM/WMI and it's class to be present for it to work.  It would have to be rewritten in C#/PowerShell to be cross platform.
